Name: Burundi
Status Comments (en): There are no lockdown or restrictions in place. However the newly elected President has launched a three-month nation-wide coronavirus screening campaign. This is the first firm commitment by the country to fight the pandemic.
Health Comments (en):
Mandatory wearing of masks in public and practicing social distancing.
UNICEF, Savonor S.A and the government implementing intiatives to make soap and water affordable.
Port Comments (en): Majority of product comes through the port of Dar es Salaam and Mombasa. See relevant port restrictions.
Transport Comments (en): Normal operations
Transit Comments (en): Increase in transport costs from port of Mombasa to Bujumbura from an average of $522 to $629.
Agro Input Access Comments (en): Normal trading
Availability Comments (en): Slight delayed in this years' procurement of fertilizers however, this is expected to have little to no impact on consumption.

Name: Ethiopia
Status Comments (en):
State of Emergency in place until September 2020.
Land borders are closed but international airports are open, with Ethiopia Airlines operating international commercial flights.
Quarantine period of persons entering the country has been revised down from 14 days to 7 days.
Health Comments (en):
The GoE, in partnership with International Organization of Migration (IOM), are distributing PPEs (surgical masks, gloves, face shields, and thermometers) to quarantine facilities in Addis Ababa. Also distributing NFIs, including mosquito nets, laundry soaps and water jerrycans in Metema quarantine facility.
16 sensitization sessions carried out at Addis Ababa quarantine facilities by IOM to inform returnees about COVID-19 precautionary measures and quarantine procedures.
Construction of 2 screening points at the entry and exit of Bule Hora Town, Oromia.
Economic Comments (en):
African Development Bank (AfDB) grants $165 Million for national COVID-19 emergency response.
Suspension of the import tariff on raw materials for the production of COVID-19 essential goods still in place.
Economic Comments (fr):
La Banque africaine de développement (BAD) accorde 165 millions de dollars pour la réponse nationale d'urgence COVID-19.
Suspension du tarif d'importation des matières premières pour la production de biens essentiels du COVID-19 toujours en place.
Port Comments (en): All imports come through the port of Djibouti. Normal operations at the Port of Djibouti, with slight delays in product movement. e.g. delays in fertilizer supply due to a delay in the delivery of fertilizer bags from India to the port; port labourers have increased their fee for loading and offloading goods, and these has in effect slowed down product movement
Transport Comments (en): Normal operations, however, delays experienced in truckloading, and a go slow among truck drivers has affected the timely transportion of fertilizers from the Djibouti port to 106 central stores.
Transit Comments (en):
Transportion costs have increased.
Significant drop in truck availability for local develivery of fertilizers, with approximately 100-120 trucks available for deliveries daily compared to 250 trucks in the past.
Agro Input Access Comments (en):
Increased costs in logistics has not been considered, in price setting (in Tigray state where the state govt sets prices) and now cooperatives and unions are recording losses.
Distribution of fertilizers to farmers, through the voucher system, limited due to restrictions on public gatherings.
Some central stores are temporarily closed, and private owners refusing to rent out additional storage spaces due to fears tied to COVID-19 spreading.
Fertilizer Price Comments (en): There's an increase in fertilizer prices attributed to the increase in transport and storage costs (in all regions except for Tigray).
Responses Comments (en):
Budget allocated to fertilizer.
Demonstrations have been reassigned to COVID-19 responses owing to restrictions on public gatherings.
NBE lifted the minimum price setting for horticultural exports.
Availability Comments (en): No expected shortage, despite delays in local fertilizer supply and distribution.

Name: Kenya
Status Comments (en):
Cessation of movement in and out of counties with high infection rates was lifted after being on partial lockdown for 2 months. 
COVID-19 cases present in 44 out of 47 counties. 
Nationwide curfew between 9pm-4am was extended to the end of July.
All basic education institutions (primary & secondary) to resume classes in January 2021. Universities, colleges and other tertiary institutions scheduled to resume in September after meeting strict COVID-19 guidelines. 
Domestic commercial flights resumed operation from the 15th July while the international flights are scheduled to resume on the 1st of August.
Health Comments (en):
Prohibiton of social and political gatherings extended to the August 6th.
Medical quarantine extended to an extra 14 days for those who test positive for COVID-19 in government quarantine facilities.
Phased reopening of places of worship with a maximum of 100 people members, exluding children below 13 years and adults above 58 years, for no more than one hour per session.
UNFPA and the Red Cross donated PPE kits amounting to $236,000 to the minsitry to enhance the health care workers' safety during provision of key services.
Donation of testing booths, beverage dispensers, hand sanitizers, surgical masks & a utility vehicle were donated by Prosel Limited, Nestle Kenya, L’Oreal EA, Isuzu East Africa, Astra Zeneca & HACO industries.
Economic Comments (en):
Equity Bank receives $5Million from IFC to be extended to SMEs hard hit by COVID-19.
Demand for Kenya's flowers has recovered by approximately 85% of pre-COVID-19 levels as European markets open up after lockdown.
Wildlife entry park fees reduced by 50 percent, effective for a one year period from July 1 2020, to target local and international tourists.
Economic Comments (fr):
Equity Bank" reçoit 5 millions de dollars de l'IFC pour être étendue aux PME durement touchées par le COVID-19.
La demande des fleurs kenyanes s'est redressée d'environ 85 % par rapport aux niveaux antérieurs du COVID-19, grâce à l'ouverture des marchés européens après le confinement.
Les entrées des parcs animaliers ont été réduites de 50 %, pour une période d'un an à partir du 1er juillet 2020, afin de cibler les touristes locaux et internationaux.
Port Comments (en): Normal operations at Port of Mombasa
Transport Comments (en):
Normal operations with movement of essential goods being permitted during the curfew hours. 
Resumption of public passenger transport services countrywide with a notable increase in fares by 67%.
Transit Comments (en): Significant delays at border crossing due to screening and testing of drivers, resulting in an increase in transport costs by logistic service providers.
Agro Input Access Comments (en): Normal trading
Fertilizer Price Comments (en):
Average commercial prices:
DAP = 3,000 KES / 50 Kg
NPK 17-17-17 = 2,000 KES / 50 Kg
CAN = 2,200 KES / 50 Kg
Urea = 2,600 KES / 50 Kg

Most DAP prices were stable. However, there was a average of -9% price decrease in 4 locations and 8% price increase in 6 locations

Most NPK prices were stable. However, there was a average of -4% price decrease in 2 locations and 9% price increase in 6 locations.

Most CAN prices increased. However, there was a average of -11% price decrease in 2 locations and 15% price increase in 16 locations.

Most Urea prices were stable. However, there was a 9% price increase in 1 location.
Fertilizer Price Comments (fr):
Les prix commerciaux moyens:
DAP = 3,000 KES / 50 Kg
NPK 17-17-17 = 2,000 KES / 50 Kg
CAN = 2,200 KES / 50 Kg
Urée = 2,600 KES / 50 Kg

La plupart des prix des DAP sont stables. Cependant, on a constaté une baisse moyenne de -9% des prix dans 4 endroits et une hausse de 8% dans 6 endroits

La plupart des prix NPK étaient stables. Cependant, on a constaté une baisse moyenne de -4% des prix dans 2 endroits et une hausse de 9% dans 6 endroits.

La plupart des prix CAN ont augmenté. Cependant, on a constaté une baisse moyenne de -11% dans deux endroits et une hausse de 15% dans 16 endroits.

La plupart des prix de l'urée sont restés stables. Toutefois, une augmentation de 9 % a été enregistrée dans un endroit.
Responses Comments (en):
$17 billion from the EU to support the Kenya govt among other thing, enhance access to agricultural inputs such as seeds and saplings to ensure food security.
Yara donating 13,000mt of NPK fertilizers targetting 73,000 smallholder farmers cultivating maize.
Availability Comments (en):
No expected shortage as long rain season draws near to the end.
Approximately 18,000mt of NPKs expected to arrive at Mombasa, reducing the forecasted decline in NPK  imports. 
CAN and Urea shipments in transit to Mombasa; OCP and ETG  awarded 10,000mt of CAN and 10,000mt of DAP to supply One Acre Fund.
Fertilizer imports in the first half of 2020 remain at 24%, compared to the same period a year earlier according to AFRIQOM data. KTDA 2020 tender cancellation remains major.

Name: Malawi
Status Comments (en):
The country has observed a spike in COVID-19 cases by over 40% over 2 weeks and this is being attributed to the high number of repatriated citizen and deportees continuing to arrive into the country from South Africa; as well as the Malawian's participation in the court-sanctioned presidential election re-run.
All learning institutions to remain closed until further notice.
A new government is in power.
Health Comments (en): COVID-19 prevention measures still in place, with social distancing and frequent hand washing being encouranged, as well as mandatory wearing of face masks.
Economic Comments (en):
FAO supporting the installation of 10 greenhouses in Lilongwe rural, Salima and Mzimba to assist 250 women farmers and a total of 3,000 indirect beneficiaries (75% women) to Build Back Better from COVID-19, in partenership with UN Women through funding from the Government of Korea.
UNICEF has initiated procurement actions worth over US$10 million for essential and strategic supplies on behalf of the Government of Malawi and other partners.
Economic Comments (fr):
La FAO soutient l'installation de 10 serres dans les zones rurales de Lilongwe, Salima et Mzimba pour aider 250 agricultrices et un total de 3 000 bénéficiaires indirects (75% de femmes) à mieux reconstruire à partir du COVID-19, en partenariat avec les Nations Unies pour les femmes grâce à un financement du gouvernement coréen.
L'UNICEF a lancé des actions d'achat de fournitures essentielles et stratégiques d'une valeur de plus de 10 millions de dollars américains pour le compte du gouvernement du Malawi et d'autres partenaires
Port Comments (en): Majority of product comes through the port of Beira. See relevant port restrictions.
Transport Comments (en): Normal operations
Transit Comments (en):
Normal operations with slight delays at border crossings due to screening. 
Dedza border crossing now open. 
Reduced staff at the border crossings.
Agro Input Access Comments (en): Normal trading
Fertilizer Price Comments (en):
Average commercial prices:
NPK 23-21-0+4S = 21,000 MWK/ 50 Kg
CAN = 18,000 MWK/ 50 Kg
Urea = 18,500 MWK / 50 Kg

Most NPK prices decreased by an average of  -6% in 12 locations. However, prices remained constant in 11 locations and there was  4% price increase in 2 locations.

Most CAN prices remained constant. However, there was a 1% price increase in 1 location.

Most Urea prices were stable. However, there was a 6% price increase in 1 location.
Fertilizer Price Comments (fr):
Les prix commerciaux moyens:
NPK 23-21-0+4S = 21,000 MWK/ 50 Kg
CAN = 18,000 MWK/ 50 Kg
Urée = 18,500 MWK / 50 Kg

La plupart des prix NPK ont diminué en moyenne de -6% dans 12 endroits. Toutefois, les prix sont restés constants dans 11 localités et ont augmenté de 4 % dans 2 localités.

La plupart des prix CAN sont restés constants. Toutefois, une augmentation de 1 % a été enregistrée dans un endroit.

La plupart des prix de l'urée sont restés stables. Toutefois, une augmentation de 6 % a été enregistrée dans un endroit.
Responses Comments (en): A new government in Malawi, wanting to implement a fertilizer subsidy scheme, faced with increased budgetary pressure due to Covid will contribute to pressure on availability of Forex to buy fertilizers.
Availability Comments (en): No expected shortage

Name: Mozambique
Status Comments (en):
Extension of the state of emergency to July 29th, with level three state of emergency measures being maintained.
Religious places of worship and bars remain closed.
Museums and art galleries to reopen with limited capacity.
Schools to remain closed, going back on a directive that was to see them reopening on 27th July.
Health Comments (en): Testing capacity increased, from 400 tests to 6,000 per day, in 4 provincial laboratories.
Economic Comments (en):
Government announces availability of $22.8 million through BNI (National Bank of Investment) to finance micro, small and medium-sized companies with an interest rate ranging from 6% - 12%.
Government authorizes entry of foreign citizens who aim to invest in Mozambique.
Businesses allowed to re-open until 5pm.
Economic Comments (fr):
Le gouvernement annonce la mise à disposition de 22,8 millions de dollars par le biais de la BNI (Banque nationale d'investissement) pour financer les micro, petites et moyennes entreprises avec un taux d'intérêt allant de 6 à 12 %.
Le gouvernement autorise l'entrée des citoyens étrangers qui souhaitent investir au Mozambique.
Les entreprises sont autorisées à rouvrir jusqu'à 17 heure
Port Comments (en):
Normal operations, with restrictions in place on unloading loose bags less than 500kgs from 15 July to increase movement of cargo. 
Restriction in working hours, with increased congestion and demurrage.
Mandatory screening of the ship crews.
Rehabilitation of the port warehouses that were severely damaged by the cyclone Idai last year has started.
Restriction at the wharf (Shorter working hours, restrictions on some product type  discharging) are causing minor delays
Transport Comments (en):
Movement of goods by duly accredited operators is permitted.
CFM rehabilitating the Beira/Machipanda railway to increase the capacity and improve the safety of traffic on the Beira corridor.
Transit Comments (en): Normal operations at border crossings
Agro Input Access Comments (en): Normal trading
Fertilizer Price Comments (en):
Average commercial prices:
DAP = 1,300 MZN / 50 Kg
NPK 12-24-12 = 1,800 MZN / 50 Kg
CAN = 1,400 MZN / 50 Kg
Urea = 1,600 MZN / 50 Kg

DAP prices remained stable in 8 locations.

Most NPK prices remained stable. However, there was an average of  12% price increase in 10 locations.

CAN prices remained stable in 2 locations.

Most Urea prices remained stable. However, there was an average of 13% price increase in 7 locations.
Fertilizer Price Comments (fr):
Les prix commerciaux moyens:
DAP = 1,300 MZN / 50 Kg
NPK 12-24-12 = 1,800 MZN / 50 Kg
CAN = 1,400 MZN / 50 Kg
Urée = 1,600 MZN / 50 Kg

Les prix du DAP sont restés stables dans 8 endroits.

La plupart des prix NPK sont restés stables. Toutefois, on a constaté une augmentation moyenne de 12 % des prix dans 10 localités.

Les prix CAN sont restés stables dans 2 localités.

La plupart des prix de l'urée sont restés stables. Cependant, il y a eu une augmentation moyenne de 13% des prix dans 7 localités.
Availability Comments (en):
No expected shortage.
Imports at the port of Beira, have exceeded 500,000mt in the period of April to July 2020 for various fertilizers

Name: Rwanda
Status Comments (en):
Lockdown imposed on Kamabuye, Zuba, Nyenyeri, and Rugano villages in Kicukiro district, and Kadobogo and Gisenga villages in Nyarugenge district for 15 days. Rusizi and parts of Kigali remain locked down.
International and domestic charter flights were re-instituted and tourism attractions reopened to revive the sector.
Health Comments (en):
COVID-19 prevention measures continue to be rigorously observed; frequent hand-washing and physical distancing, with mandatory wearing of face masks in public.
Rwanda Biomedical Centre to begin a COVID-19 street testing survey in Kigali and at the entry points to Kigali. There is also a drive-through testing scheme at the national stadium.
Economic Comments (en): Suspended charges on electronic money transactions reinstated on June 22.
Economic Comments (fr): Suspension des frais sur les opérations de monnaie électronique rétablie le 22 juin.
Port Comments (en): Majority of product comes through the port of Mombasa and Dar es Salaam. See relevant port restrictions.
Transport Comments (en): Normal operations with exception of Rusizi and parts of Kigali which are still locked down.
Transit Comments (en): Normal movement of transit goods at the border.
Agro Input Access Comments (en): Normal trading
Responses Comments (en): Rwanda Fertilizer Company (RFC) supporting smallholder farmers by facilitating them with at least 500mt of DAP fertilizers estimated to be used on 5,000ha
Availability Comments (en): No expected shortage.

Name: South Africa
Status Comments (en):
Lockdown level 3 is still in place.
Surge in infections after the government allowed businesses to reopen. May revise the lockdown levels upwards to slow the spread.
Health Comments (en):
First COVID-19 vaccine trial in South Africa begins.
Conversion of convention centres in Cape Town and Johannesburg, and and a closed car manufacturing plant into medical wards in a bid to increase hospital capacity.
Museums, cinemas, casinos and worship gatherings permitted but limited to 50 people.
Economic Comments (en):
Government assisting companies and workers through Unemployment Insurance Fund and other special programs.
Depreciation of the local currency (rand) by 16% vis a vis the US dollar.
Economic Comments (fr):
Le gouvernement assiste les entreprises et les travailleurs par le biais de la Caisse d'assurance chômage et d'autres programmes spéciaux.
Dépréciation de la monnaie locale (rand) de 16% par rapport au dollar américain
Port Comments (en): Majority of product comes through the port of Dar es Salaam. See relevant port restrictions.
Transit Comments (en):
Normal operations with slight delays at border crossings due to screening.
Beitbridge Border Post reopens after temporary closure.
Agro Input Access Comments (en): Off season. Limited trading
Availability Comments (en):
No expected shortage.
Local supply of MAP threatned with Foskor affected by fire at facility, that halted production. External supply assured from Saudi Arabia and Russia to cover MAP demand as season starts. 
28,000t of potential Iranian Uea, supplied via Duran port.

Name: Tanzania
Status Comments (en):
No lockdown or restrictions
Country declared COVID-19 free; business as usual
International borders open
Health Comments (en): Washing of hands and use of sanitizers encouraged.
Economic Comments (en): VAT and customs duties exemptions to imported medical equipment and medical supplies.
Economic Comments (fr): Exonération de la TVA et des droits de douane pour les équipements médicaux et les fournitures médicales importés.
Port Comments (en):
Normal operations
Shipping lines urged to extend the demurrage free period by between 10 and 25 days on different destinations, giving Dar es Salaam port an edge over Mombasa port, Kenya
Transport Comments (en): Normal operations
Agro Input Access Comments (en): Normal trading
Fertilizer Price Comments (en):

Most Urea prices remained stable. However, there was a -3% price decrease in 1 location and 12% price increase in 3 locations
Fertilizer Price Comments (fr):

Urée  = 57,000 TZS / 50 Kg

La plupart des prix du DAP sont restés stables. Toutefois, une augmentation de 1 % des prix a été constatée dans un endroit.

La plupart des prix NPK sont restés stables. Cependant, il y a eu une augmentation moyenne de 6 % des prix dans 4 localités.

La plupart des prix CAN sont restés stables. Cependant, il y a eu une baisse de 7 % dans un endroit et une augmentation de 12 % dans quatre endroits.

Responses Comments (en): TFRA BPS on schedule ensuring timely supply. Potential to benefit from seasonal price cycle.
Availability Comments (en):
No expected shortage.
Ammonuim Sulphate consignment in transit from the US.
DAP shipment in transit in addition to TFRA BPS consignments.
Swiss Singapore’s 25,000mt of Urea under TFRA BPS, loaded in Yantai China with an ETA of August 05 (cargo is potentially a re-export load.)

Name: Uganda
Status Comments (en):
Daily curfew timing revised for 9pm to 5.30am.
Lockdown measures in Gulu district.
Schools remain closed, with an expected updated on the way forward coming in August.
International borders remain closed.
Business allowed to reopen. Public bicycle and motorcycle taxis allowed back in operation from July 27, operating until 6pm.
Health Comments (en):
Reopening of public and private transport in selected border districts that have not registred any COVID-19 infections.
Increased number of occupants of private cars from 60% to 80%.
Economic Comments (en): $300 million budget support recovery approved by World Bank
Economic Comments (fr): La Banque mondiale approuve le recouvrement d'un soutien budgétaire de 300 millions de dollars
Port Comments (en): Majority of product comes through the port of Mombasa. See relevant port restrictions.
Transport Comments (en): Normal operations countrywide except in border districts
Transit Comments (en):
Normal movement at border crossing. However, significant delays experienced at the Busia border crossings, attributed to screening and testing of drivers. Drivers found to be defaulting the COVID-19 social guidelines.
15 Kenyan truck drivers denied entry after testing postive for COVID-19
Agro Input Access Comments (en): Normal trading between from 9am to 2pm

La plupart des prix du DAP sont restés stables. Cependant, on a constaté une augmentation moyenne de 9 % des prix dans 5 endroits.

La plupart des prix de l'urée sont restés stables. Cependant, on a constaté une augmentation moyenne de 8 % des prix dans 6 localités.
Availability Comments (en): No expected shortage.

Name: Zambia
Status Comments (en):
COVID-19 cases reported in 44 districts. 
Businesses allowed to operate, except for bars and casinos.
Plan underway to reopen the remaining school classes. Examination classes (in primary and high school) already opened.
Government set to reopen international borders.                                                                                                                                           
Zambia's parliament forced to adjourn after legislator succums to COVID-19.
Health Comments (en):
Adherance to guidelines and social measures set before still in place, includin, social distancing and mandatory wearing of masks. 
Donation of medical equipment and transport facilities by WHO to MOH to help the country curb the spread of COVID-19.
Economic Comments (en): Approval of $438 million COVID-19 economic stimulus package by Zambia cabinet
Economic Comments (fr): Approbation d'un plan de relance économique COVID-19 de 438 millions de dollars par le cabinet zambien
Port Comments (en): Majority of product comes through the port of Beira and Dar es Salaam. See relevant port restrictions.
Transport Comments (en): Normal operations
Transit Comments (en): Normal movement at border crossing with mandatory driver testing.
Agro Input Access Comments (en): Normal trading
Fertilizer Price Comments (en):
Average commercial prices:
NPK 10-20-10 (Compound D) = 449 ZMW / 50 Kg
Urea = 440 ZMW / 50 Kg
Fertilizer Price Comments (fr):

NPK 10-20-10 (Compound D) = 449 ZMW / 50 Kg
Urée = 440 ZMW / 50 Kg
Responses Comments (en): AFAP and African Green Resources (AGR) launched a $40 million joint venture, to boost access to finance amid the COVID-19 pandemic. The joint venture will provide the farmers with credit packages for seed, fertilizer, and training.
Availability Comments (en):
No expected shortages.
One Acre Fund has awards ETG tender to supply 1,206t NPK compound D and 1,138t Urea.

Name: Zimbabwe
Status Comments (en):
Country in lockdown for an indefinite period. The lockdown restrictions to be tightened, through measures such as introducing localized lockdowns in hotspot areas to curb the further spread of the virus.
Nationwide curfew between 6pm to 6am.
Further economy reopening plans halted.
Reopening of schools scheduled for July 28 deferred pending a review of the situation amid a spike in COVID-19 infections.
Zimbabwe health minister fired over $60M COVID-19 graft.                                                                                                                                                                                  
All public gatherings for social and religious purposes banned, funerals remain curtailed at 50, breach of measures to attract severe punishment.
Health Comments (en):
Shortage of nurses as COVID-19 cases surge.
All arrivals subjected to strict screening procedures including rigorous enforcement of a 21-day self-quarantine.
Churches reopen with social distancing and maximum of 50 people.
Economic Comments (en):
Commercial, mining and manufacturing sectors open under new norms. 
Informal sector and open markets to open. 
Partial opening of tourism sector (mainly domestic), including national parks and local safaris. 
Only registered SMES allowed to operate; food markets to remain operational under new norms. 
Sit-in restaurants to serve at half capacity. Bars and gyms not allowed to operate
Economic Comments (fr):
Les secteurs commercial, minier et manufacturier s'ouvrent sous de nouvelles normes. 
Secteur informel et ouverture des marchés. 
Ouverture partielle du secteur du tourisme (principalement intérieur), y compris les parcs nationaux et les safaris locaux. 
Seules les PME enregistrées sont autorisées à opérer ; les marchés alimentaires restent opérationnels selon les nouvelles normes. 
Les restaurants "sit-in" doivent servir à moitié de leur capacité. Les bars et les gymnases ne sont pas autorisés à fonctionner
Port Comments (en): Majority of product comes through the port of Beira and Durban. See relevant port restrictions.
Transport Comments (en):
Movement of goods allowed.  
Inter-city public transport to partly resume operations allowing for only essential travel
Transit Comments (en): Normal movement at border crossing with screening of drivers.
Agro Input Access Comments (en): Normal trading subject to National Social Safety and Health Authority directives

NPK 7-14-7 = 25 USD / 50 Kg
NPK 5-15-12 = 28 USD / 50 Kg
Urée = 29 USD / 50 Kg

Name: Benin
Status Comments (en):
The situation linked to the coronavirus pandemic remains largely unchanged in Benin, especially with regards to the numbers of confirmed cases, which is about 1,602 confirmed cases, this includes the 789 active cases.                                           
The government has made face masks compulsory in all places, and also ban gatherings of more than fifty (50) people.                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
They have also suspended sports, political and festive events and demonstrations.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
The airports have resumed in strict compliance with health measures.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
Since the begining of the crisis the government has launched a 74 billion response plan to try to contain the effects of the health crisis and revive the economy.
Status Comments (fr): La situation liée à la pandemie du coronavirus évolue peu au Benin avec 1602 cas confimés dont 789 cas actifs. le gouvernement a décidé du port obligatoire de masques en tous lieux; l’interdiction des rassemblements de plus de cinquante (50) personnes ; la suspension des événements et manifestations à caractères sportif, politique et festif ; les voies aériennes ont repris dans le strict respect des mesures sanitaires. Depuis l'avenement de la crise le gouvernement a lancé un plan de riposte de 74 milliards pour tenter de contenir les effets de la crise sanitaire et relancer l’économie
Health Comments (en):
The compulsory wearing of masks in all places.

Status Comments (en):
The COVID-19 reproduction rate was 0.62. The state of emergency was lifted on May 30 throughout the archipelago, but the return to normalcy is being gradual and in compliance with the restrictive measures in force.

Les frontières extérieures aériennes demeurent fermées jusqu’au mois d’août. Les liaisons aériennes intérieures devraient en revanche reprendre à compter de la semaine du 13 juillet.

Le port du masque lors des sorties et le respect de la distance sociale sont toujours obligatoires.

Name: Guinea
Status Comments (en):
The government has decided to extend the state of emergency for 30 days from July 15 throughout the country.                                                   
The curfew is reduced by one hour and is set from 12 a.m. to 4 a.m. hours for the “Greater Conakry” zone, and remains fully lifted inside the country. Air borders will gradually reopen from July 17, 2020.                                                                                                                      
Access to public and private places (markets, restaurants, banks, etc.) will be subject to compliance with health barriers.
Since the start of the crisis, the government has adopted an "economic response plan" to Covid-19, endowed with more than 3,000 billion Guinean francs (292 million euros). "
Status Comments (fr):
Le gouvernement a décidé de la prolongation de 30 jours de l'état d'urgence à compter du 15 juillet sur toute l'étendu du territoire. Le couvre-feu est reduit d'une heure et s'établit de 00 heures à 04 heures pour la zone du « Grand Conakry » et reste entièrement levé à l’Intérieur du pays. Les frontières aériennes vont connaître une réouverture progressive à partir du 17 juillet 2020. L'accès aux lieux publics et privés (marchés, restaurants, banques, etc.) sera soumis au respect de barrières sanitaires)
Depuis le debut de la crise le gouvernement a adopté un "plan de réponse économique" à Covid-19, doté de plus de 3 000 milliards de francs guinéens (292 millions d'euros).
Health Comments (en):
The state of emergency is renewed for a period of 30 days from July 15, 2020, throughout the national territory. 
The curfew is lifted inside the country, in Conakry a further reduction of one hour in the curfew It is now from midnight to 4 a.m.  
Wearing a mask is compulsory in public spaces. Gatherings of 30 people maximum allowed.
Access to public and private places (markets, restaurants, banks, etc.) will be subject to compliance with health barriers.
Health Comments (fr):
L’état d’urgence est reconduit pour une période de 30 jours à compter du 15 juillet 2020, sur toute l’étendue du territoire national. Le couvre-feu est levé à l'intérieur du pays, à Conakry une nouvelle reduction d'une heure du couvre-feu. Il est maintenant de 00h à 4h. 
Le port du masque est obligatoire dans l’espace public. Rassemblement de 30 personnes maximum autorisé.
L'accès aux lieux publics et privés (marchés, restaurants, banques, etc.) sera soumis au respect de barrières sanitaires)
Economic Comments (en): Approval by the President of an "economic response plan" to COVID-19, endowed with more than $340 million
Economic Comments (fr): Approbation par le Président d'un "plan de réponse économique" à Covid-19, doté de plus de 340 millions de dollars.
Port Comments (en):
Invoicing of demurrage at the port and at the airport is suspended for three months.
The port sanitary team should inspect the ship's crew before the local pilots; authorities and dockworkers are boarding and air and land borders are also closed.
Port Comments (fr):
La facturation des surestaries au port et à l'aéroport est suspendue pendant trois mois
L'équipe sanitaire du port doit inspecter l'équipage des navires avant les pilotes locaux ; les autorités et les dockers montent à bord et les frontières aériennes et terrestres sont également fermées.
Transport Comments (en): The transport of fertilizers and other goods is authorized (the driver and two assistants); however, these people can only travel if the test results are negative after 48 hours.
Transport Comments (fr): Le transport d'engrais et d'autres marchandises est autorisé (le chauffeur et deux assistants) ; toutefois, ces personnes ne peuvent voyager que si les résultats des tests sont négatifs après 48 heures
Transit Comments (en): Road freight: Border closed since March 22. Air borders will be gradually reopened from July 17, 2020.
Transit Comments (fr): Fret routier : Frontière fermée depuis le 22 mars. Les frontières aériennes vont connaître une réouverture progressive à partir du 17 juillet 2020
Agro Input Access Comments (en): Open but farmers are reluctant to buy.
Agro Input Access Comments (fr): Ouvert mais réticence des agriculteurs à acheter
Fertilizer Price Comments (en):
Average commercial prices:
NPK 15-15-15 = 270,000 GNF
Urea = 265,000 GNF Subsidized price: NPK 15-15-15: 1,350,000 GNF
Urea: 132,500 GNF
Subsidized prices are set at the start of the farming season.

Les prix commerciaux moyens:
NPK 15-15-15 = 270000 GNF
Urée = 265000 GNF

L'urée : 132500 GNF
Les prix subventionnés sont fixés au début de la saison agricole.
Responses Comments (en):
It is planned to distribute 50,000mt of fertilizer for cotton and cereals. The subsidy rate represents 50% of the commercial price of fertilizers (NPK and urea)
According to Argus report, COVID 19 hampers government attempt to tender for NPK 15-15-15 and Urea, but informal discussions are underway
The government announces support for the cashew, potato and pineapple sectors, which have been severely affected by the crisis
Responses Comments (fr):
Il est prévu de distribuer 50 000 tonnes d'engrais pour le coton et les céréales. Le taux de subvention représente 50 % du prix commercial des engrais (NPK et urée)
D'après le rapport Argus, la covid 19 entrave la tentative du gouvernement de lancer un appel d'offres pour le NPK 15-15-15 et l'urée, mais des discussions informelles sont en cours
Le gouvernement annonce un soutien aux secteurs de la noix de cajou, de la pomme de terre et de l'ananas, qui ont été fortement touchés par la crise

Name: Guinea Bissau
Status Comments (en):
The state of emergency has been extended by 30 days until 25 July. The curfew is maintained, but the population can now go out for one hour between 07:00 and 18:00.                                                                                                                                                                  
All cafés, restaurants and bakeries are restricted to take-away sales.
The country officially announced 1,556 cases of Covid-19, including 191 cured and 19 deaths. 
Closure of all non-essential businesses except for grocery stores and drugstores.
Status Comments (fr): L'état d'urgence a été prolongé de 30 jours" jusqu'au 25 juillet.Le couvre-feu est maintenu, mais la population peut désormais sortir entre 7h et 18h. Tous les cafés, les restaurants et les boulangeries sont limités aux plats à emporter ventes. le pays a officiellement annoncé 1 556 cas de Covid-19, dont 191 guéris et 19 décès. Fermeture de tous les commerces non essentiels à l'exception des épiceries, des pharmacies.
Economic Comments (en): Closure of all non-essential businesses except for grocery stores, drugstores.
Economic Comments (fr): Fermeture de tous les commerces non essentiels à l'exception des épiceries, des pharmacies.
Port Comments (en): Port is still operational but vessel will be inspected and controlled by health Authorities
Port Comments (fr): Le port est toujours en activité, mais les navires seront inspectés et contrôlé par les autorités sanitaires
Transport Comments (en): The traffic permit for public transport.
Transport Comments (fr): Le permis de circulation pour les transports publics.
Transit Comments (en):
The closure of land borders and a ban on all flights landing at Osvaldo Viera International Airport beginning
All movement from land or airport has been suspended as of 18th March 2020 until further notice.
Transit Comments (fr): La fermeture des frontières terrestres et l'interdiction de tous les vols à l'aéroport international Osvaldo Viera. Tout mouvement à partir de la terre ou de l'aéroport a été suspendu à partir du 18 mars 2020 jusqu'à nouvel ordre.
Fertilizer Price Comments (en):
Average commercial prices: May
Urea: FCFA 16,000-17,000
NPK T15: FCFA 18,000
Fertilizer Price Comments (fr):
Les prix commerciaux moyens: Mai
Urée : FCFA 16.000-17.000
NPK T15 : 18 000 FCFA
Responses Comments (en):
With the support of Japanese cooperation, the supply of fertilizers for rice to the government makes it possible to reduce fertilizer price to farmers.
FAO plans to support the supply of fertilizers to farmers. FAO has invited companies to bid for 2,000 tons of fertilizer which includes 1,500 tons of NPK15-15-15 and 500 tons of urea.
Responses Comments (fr):
Avec le soutien de la coopération japonaise, la fourniture de des engrais pour le riz au gouvernement permet de
réduire le prix d'engrais pour les agriculteurs. FAO a prévu de soutenir la foruniture d'engrais pour les agriculteurs. FAO a invité les entreprises à soumissionner pour 2 000 tonnes d'engrais dont 1500 tonnes de NPK15-15-15 et 500 tonnes d'urée.
Availability Comments (en): More than 50% of fertilizer stocks are available for the season. However, if stocks are reduced, irrigated rice and lowland rice cultivation will be heavily impacted.
Availability Comments (fr): Plus de 50 % des stocks d'engrais sont disponibles pour la saison. Toutefois, si les stocks sont réduits, le riz irrigué et la culture du riz de plaine sera fortement touchée.

Name: Liberia
Status Comments (en):
Ban on all movement between the country's 15 counties.                                                                                                                                                  
Closure of non-essential businesses, and stay-at-home orders.                                                                                                                
The president allowed churches and mosques to resume services at 25-percent capacity to allow for social distancing.
Status Comments (fr):
Avec une interdiction de tout mouvement entre les 15 comtés du pays.                                                                                                                                                 
La fermeture des entreprises non essentielles et les ordonnances de rester à domicile.                                                                                                               
Le président a autorisé les églises et les mosquées à reprendre les services à 25 % de leur capacité pour permettre la distanciation sociale.
Health Comments (en):
The Government of Liberia extended the lockdown in the country, made the use of face masks compulsory in public places.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            
Issued extension of a state of emergency, suspension of all non-essential travel and curfews at 18:00.
Health Comments (fr):
Le gouvernement du Liberia a prolongé la quarantaine dans le pays, rendant obligatoire l'utilisation de masques de protection dans les lieux publics.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            
Prolongation de l'état d'urgence, suspension de tous les déplacements non essentiels et couvre-feu à partir de 18h00.
Economic Comments (en):
The IMF granted Liberia debt service relief under the Catastrophe Containment and Relief Trust (CCRT) to address the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic. 
The US embassy in Liberia has donated approximately $40 million as part of its yearly $100 million commitment to the health sector to assist in curbing the spread of the COVID-19 pandemic. 
The World Bank has approved a $7.5 million International Development Association (IDA) financing to help Liberia respond effectively to the COVID-19 pandemic. 
The president requested the Legislature to re-appropriate U.S.$25 million for the remainder of the 2019/2020 budget year in support of the government's stimulus package.
Economic Comments (fr):
Le FMI a accordé au Liberia un allègement du service de la dette dans le cadre du Fonds fiduciaire pour l'endiguement et le soulagement des catastrophes (CCRT) afin de faire face à l'impact de la pandémie COVID-19. 
L'ambassade des États-Unis au Liberia a fait don d'environ 40 millions de dollars dans le cadre de son engagement annuel de 100 millions de dollars en faveur du secteur de la santé pour aider à freiner la propagation de la pandémie COVID-19. 
La Banque mondiale a approuvé un financement de 7,5 millions de dollars de l'Association internationale de développement (IDA) pour aider le Libéria à répondre efficacement à la pandémie de COVID-19. 
La présidente a demandé à l'Assemblée législative de réapproprier 25 millions de dollars américains pour le reste de l'année budgétaire 2019/2020 afin de soutenir le plan de relance du gouvernement.
Port Comments (en): Sea Freight: Sea port is open under health task force observation, published a guidance to assist ship operations by Liberia Maritime Authority
Port Comments (fr): Sea Freigtt : le port maritime est ouvert sous l'observation de la task force sanitaire, qui a publié un guide pour aider les opérations des navires par l'autorité maritime du Liberia
Transport Comments (en):
Minimization of travel within Liberia.                                       
The Ministry of Agriculture (MOA) and the Executive Committee on COVID-19 (ECOC) launched Liberia's Agriculture Transport Permit System, a tool that enables agriculture authorities to grant temporary permission to agriculture actors to move between approved counties amidst the lockdown.
Transport Comments (fr):
Réduction des déplacements à l'intérieur du Libéria.                                       
Le ministère de l'agriculture (MOA) et le comité exécutif de COVID-19 (ECOC) ont lancé le système de permis de transport agricole du Libéria, un outil qui permet aux autorités agricoles d'accorder une autorisation temporaire aux acteurs du secteur agricole de se déplacer entre les comtés approuvés en pleine période de fermeture.
Transit Comments (en): The country's land borders with Guinea and Cote d'Ivoire was closed  in an effort to contain the spread of COVID-19.
Transit Comments (fr): Les frontières terrestres du pays avec la Guinée et la Côte d'Ivoire ont été fermées afin de contenir la propagation de COVID-19.
Agro Input Access Comments (en): Supply of inputs is limited in Liberia. This situation has a significant impact on the large agricultural companies that are the biggest users of fertilizer. Some of them are planning to reduce their operations because of their inability to import essential inputs, including fertilizer.
Agro Input Access Comments (fr): La fourniture d'intrants est limitée au Liberia. Cette situation a un impact significatif sur les grandes entreprises agricoles qui sont les plus grands utilisateurs d'engrais. Certaines d'entre elles prévoient de réduire leurs opérations en raison de leur incapacité à importer des intrants essentiels, notamment des engrais.
Fertilizer Price Comments (en):
Average commercial prices:
Urea – 45 dollars/50kg bag
NPK 45-50 dollars/50kg bag
Fertilizer Price Comments (fr):
Les prix commerciaux moyens:
Urée : 45 dollars par sac de 50 kg
NPK 45-50 $ par sac de 50 kg
Responses Comments (en): Formulation of COVID-19 Emergency Food Security Response Plan to fast track the procurement process of various types of fertilizers and tractors for distribution to farmers across the country ahead of the planting season.
Responses Comments (fr): Formulation du plan d'intervention d'urgence en matière de sécurité alimentaire COVID-19 pour accélérer le processus d'achat de divers types d'engrais et de tracteurs destinés à être distribués aux agriculteurs du pays avant la saison de semis.
Availability Comments (en): There is a major scarcity of fertilizers in the country as farmers, through Ministry of Agriculture’s Coordinators in rural Liberia, lament the shortage hampers crops production in this farming season.
Availability Comments (fr): Il y a une grande pénurie d'engrais dans le pays car les agriculteurs, par l'intermédiaire des coordinateurs du ministère de l'agriculture dans les zones rurales du Liberia, déplorent que la pénurie entrave la production des cultures en cette saison agricole.

Name: Mauritania
Status Comments (en):
The government has decided to ease the measures, in particular the complete lifting of the curfew and the reopening of airports for domestic flights.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                
The land, air and sea borders will remain closed, and the wearing of a mask is compulsory in public places.                                                                                
Since May, the reopening of markets and places of worship.                                                                                                                                                                
The World Bank has awarded a $5.2 million grant to Mauritania through the International Development Association to strengthen the country's health system in the wake of COVID-19.

Les frontières terrestres, aériennes et maritimes resteront fermées et le port du masque obligatoire dans les lieux publics.depuis le mois de mai la réouverture des marchés et lieux de cultes. La Banque mondiale a accordé une subvention de 5,2 millions de dollars à la Mauritanie par l'intermédiaire de l'Association internationale de développement pour renforcer le système de santé du pays dans le sillage de COVID-19
Health Comments (en):
Complete lifting of curfew and reopening of airports for domestic flights.                                                                                  
Reopening of markets and places of worship since May.
Health Comments (fr):
Levée complète du couvre-feu et la réouverture des aéroports pour les vols domestiques. 
Réouverture des marchés et lieux de cultes depuis le mois de mai
Economic Comments (en): The World Bank has awarded a $ 5.2 million grant to Mauritania through the International Development Association to strengthen the country's health system in the wake of COVID-19.
Economic Comments (fr): La Banque mondiale a accordé une subvention de 5,2 millions de dollars à la Mauritanie par l'intermédiaire de l'Association internationale de développement pour renforcer le système de santé du pays dans le sillage de COVID-19
Port Comments (en):
Sea Freight: Port and Customs still operating. 
BCP in place for Logistics.                                     
Shipping and Terminal to keep on operating.

Le port est opérationnel. Les engrais continuent d'arriver par le port.
Les opérations logistiques ne sont pas affectées
Ralentissement des opérations à cause de la réduction des effectifs
Transport Comments (en):
Works going normally.                                                                                                                               
Goods continue to flow.
Transportation costs are stable.                                                                                                              
Opening of road traffic between the various cities and provinces of the country.
Transport Comments (fr):
Fonctionne normalement. Les marchandises continuent de circuler.
Les coûts de transport sont stables.  l'ouverture du trafic routier entre les différentes villes et provinces du pays,
Transit Comments (en):
8 out of the 45 Mauritanian border crossing points remain active for the transport of goods and food.                                                                                                        
Land and air borders remain closed.
Transit Comments (fr): 8 des 45 points de passage de la frontière mauritanienne restent actifs pour le transport de marchandises et de denrées alimentaires. les frontières terrestres et aériennes restent fermées.
Agro Input Access Comments (en): Fertilizer sales continue as usual
Agro Input Access Comments (fr): Les ventes d'engrais se poursuivent comme d'habitude
Fertilizer Price Comments (en):
No private market. Fertilizers are subsidized for all farmers.
100% subsidized, no commercial price. Prices are set at the start of the agricultural season.
Urea: for cooperatives at 9.3 mru / kg and 11 mru / kg for individuals.
DAP: for cooperatives at 13 mru / kg and 14 mru / kg for individuals "
Fertilizer Price Comments (fr):
Pas de marché privé. Les engrais sont subventionnés pour tous les agriculteurs.
Subventionné à 100%, sans prix commercial. Les prix sont fixés au début de la saison agricole.
Urée : pour les coopératives à 9,3 mru/kg et 11 mru/kg pour les particuliers.
